intro: Staphidium galeottii, commonly known as the purple mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet-pink flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Staphidium galeottii is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
